lexUnit.name: simmer.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to cook slowly in a liquid just below the boiling point in a closed dish or pan

sentence.text: I think it has a fragrance reminiscent of Darjeeling tea while it is simmering .
Horsley passed the test and went off to see Thornton , who was still simmering and had nothing but dire warnings for him .
Allow to simmer for 4 minutes and then , using a ladle , very carefully strain the liquid through a conical strainer covered with a muslin cloth .
She was still quietly simmering from her interview with Naylor Massingham last Monday .
Better though that he simmered for a while , Carrie thought as she stirred the greens and tested the potatoes with a fork .
Bring to the boil and allow to simmer until cooked , then add the crème de cassis to taste .
Stir it softly over a slow fire , and when it begins to simmer , take it off , and by degrees stir it into the gooseberries .
Later , when she went to the dining-room , Lucy was still simmering with resentment , and she knew that unless she pulled herself together it would begin to show .
Leave to simmer gently until the mixture is of a syrupy consistency .
But it had been simmering for a couple of years before that .
When it was simmering slowly in the Aga she went into Penry , who was searching distractedly through piles of medical tomes .
It 's the latest twist in the lengthy club versus country row which has simmered for the last two seasons .
Bring it to the boil and let it simmer for 5 minutes .
There was a darkness in his eyes , anger simmering just beneath the surface .
